Equine Antibodies Neutralized WNV in Cell Culture using a plaque reduction-neutralizing assay. we found that the immune sera effectively neutralized WNV infection in vitro. equine IgG and F(ab′)2 also neutralized WNV infection. purified horse immune IgG or purified horse immune F(ab′)2 survived. 50% of the mice that received the horse IgG one day before the infection survived. mice from the control group died, whereas 90% of mice that received the horse immune IgG survived; the F(ab′)2 treatment protected only 30% of the mice. antibody treatment decreased the virus load in both the WT and Mavs/ mice. p = 0.009 when Control group compared to hIgG group. p = 0.0291 when Control group compared to hIgG group. eight to twelve-week-old WT (A,B) and Mavs/ mice were infected with 100 PFU WNV. titers in serum were up to 1:40,960 after five immunizations. equine anti-WNV immunoglobulin and neutralizing F(ab′)2 decreased the virus load and protected mice from a lethal WNV infection. mavs/ mice are immunocompromised with the deficiency of MAVS gene which is important for viral RNA sensing. the quality of the neutralization antibody can influence the treatment efficacy, which may depend on the quantity and quality of the F(ab′)2 fragments. the results of this study show that F(ab′)2 fragments are not as efficient as IgG, both in vitro and in vivo. both treatments with equine anti-WNV immunoglobulin or neutralizing F(ab′)2 decreased the viral loads in the spleens and brains. equine immunoglobulin and neutralizing F(ab′)2 passive immunotherapy could be potentially useful for the treatment of patients infected with WNV.
